RECORD.TEXT: CTMC 75066875 828710 02/21/1991 12:00:00 AM DIS Admission Date : 02/21/1991 Report Status : Discharge Date : 02/26/1991 LEFT RENAL MASS . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : A computerized tomography scan demonstrated a contrast enhancing complex left renal mass . Metastatic work-up was negative . The patient presented for nephrectomy . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY included appendectomy and bunionectomy . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION were Hydrea . REVIEW OF SYSTEMS was negative in detail . The patient was a robust white female in no acute distress , afebrile , blood pressure 165/80 . Head and neck were unremarkable . Abdomen was benign . Rectal examination was guaiac negative . Extremities and neurological examinations were unremarkable . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient thereafter had a benign convalescence , and was discharged on the 5th postoperative day . The oncology fellows from Venbonlea Health followed her course and recommended holding off on her Hydrea while she is hospitalized , and they will follow her as an outpatient and restart her Hydrea when her hematocrit is over 40% . DISPOSITION : The patient was discharged to home . The patient was discharged on a regular diet . CONDITION ON DISCHARGE was stable . FOLLOW-UP will be with Dr. Suot N. Dragtente and with her Venbonlea Health oncology fellows . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE included Percocet 1 to 2 tablets by mouth every 4 hours as needed for pain , Colace 100 milligrams by mouth twice a day . PL926/1533 SUOT N. DRAGTENTE , M.D. GJ7 02/26/91 Batch : P9055V6 03/02/91 Dicatated By : ESPEXIINE BRIZ , M.D. XT67 cc : 1. VENBONLEA HEALTH
